summary: Cost and schedule overruns have plagued DOD’s major defense acquisition programs, with current projected costs exceeding initial expectations by $484 billion and delays averaging 31 months. To keep programs on track, DOD relies on program managers who can balance factors that influence cost, schedule, and performance. The military services have taken steps to develop top-notch talent for this role. We compared their practices for training...
title: Defense Acquisition Workforce: Opportunities Exist to Improve Practices for Developing Program Managers
